lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the strengths and limitations of a model.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use symbols and formulae to represent scientific ideas.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify whether a given hypothesis is testable.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how scientific hypotheses can be supported or contradicted by evidence from an enquiry.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make predictions of likely outcomes for a scientific enquiry based on scientific knowledge and understanding.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Plan a range of investigations of different types; while considering variables appropriately; and recognise that not all investigations can be fair tests.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know the meaning of hazard symbols; and consider them when planning practical work.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Sort; group and classify phenomena; objects; materials and organisms through testing; observation; using secondary information; and making and using keys.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Decide what equipment is required to carry out an investigation or experiment and use it appropriately.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate whether measurements and observations have been repeated sufficiently to be reliable.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Take appropriately accurate and precise measurements; explaining why accuracy and precision are important.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Carry out practical work safely.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate a range of secondary information sources for their relevance and know that some sources may be biased.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Collect and record sufficient observations and/or measurements in an appropriate form.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the accuracy of predictions; based on results; and suggest why they were or were not accurate.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe trends and patterns in results; including identifying any anomalous results.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make conclusions by interpreting results and explain the limitations of the conclusions.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate experiments and investigations; and suggest improvements; explaining any proposed changes.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Present and interpret observations and measurements appropriately.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that all organisms are made of cells and microorganisms are typically single celled.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify and describe the functions of cell structures (limited to cell membrane; cytoplasm; nucleus; cell wall; chloroplast; mitochondria and sap vacuole).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain how the structures of some specialised cells are related to their functions (including red blood cells; neurones; ciliated cells; root hair cells and palisade cells).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the similarities and differences between the structures of plant and animal cells.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that cells can be grouped together to form tissues; organs and organ systems.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the seven characteristics of living organisms.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss reasons for classifying viruses as living or non-living.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe a species as a group of organisms that can reproduce to produce fertile offspring.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use and construct dichotomous keys to classify species and groups of related organisms.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know and describe the ecological role some microorganisms have as decomposers.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Construct and interpret food chains and webs which include microorganisms as decomposers.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that all matter is made of atoms; with each different type of atom being a different element.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that the Periodic Table presents the known elements in an order.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know metals and non-metals as the two main groupings of elements.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the differences between elements; compounds and mixtures; including alloys as an example of a mixture.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe a vacuum as a space devoid of matter.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the three states of matter as solid; liquid and gas in terms of the arrangement; separation and motion of particles.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use the particle model to represent elements; compounds and mixtures.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that all substances have chemical properties and physical properties.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the acidity or alkalinity of a substance is a chemical property and is measured by pH.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use indicators (including Universal Indicator and litmus) to distinguish between acidic; alkaline and neutral solutions.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use tests to identify hydrogen; carbon dioxide and oxygen gases.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe common differences between metals and non-metals; referring to their physical properties.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that alloys are mixtures that have different chemical and physical properties from the constituent substances.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use the particle model to explain the difference in hardness between pure metals and their alloys.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify whether a chemical reaction has taken place through observations of the loss of reactants and/or the formation of products which have different properties to the reactants (including evolving a gas; formation of a precipitate or change of colour).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain why a precipitate forms; in terms of a chemical reaction between soluble reactants forming at least one insoluble product.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use the particle model to describe chemical reactions.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe neutralisation reactions in terms of change of pH.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe changes in energy that are a result of an event or process.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that energy tends to dissipate and in doing so it becomes less useful.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe gravity as a force of attraction between any two objects and describe how the size of the force is related to the masses of the objects.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that there is no air resistance to oppose movement in a vacuum.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the vibration of particles in a sound wave and explain why sound does not travel in a vacuum.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain echoes in terms of the reflection of sound waves.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use a simple model to describe electricity as a flow of electrons around a circuit.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe electrical conductors as substances that allow electron flow and electrical insulators as substances that inhibit electron flow.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know how to measure the current in series circuits.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how adding components into a series circuit can affect the current (limited to addition of cells and lamps).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use diagrams and conventional symbols to represent; make and compare circuits that include cells; switches; lamps; buzzers and ammeters.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the model of plate tectonics; in which a solid outer layer (made up of the crust and uppermost mantle) moves because of flow lower in the mantle.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how earthquakes; volcanoes and fold mountains occur near the boundaries of tectonic plates.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that clean; dry air contains 78% nitrogen; 21% oxygen and small amounts of carbon dioxide and other gases; and this composition can change because of pollution and natural emissions.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the water cycle (limited to evaporation; condensation; precipitation; water run-off; open water and groundwater).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how planets form from dust and gas; which are pulled together by gravity.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that gravity is the force that holds components of the Solar System in orbit around the Sun.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe tidal forces on Earth as a consequence of the gravitational attraction between the Earth; Moon and Sun.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain how solar and lunar eclipses happen.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how scientific knowledge is developed through collective understanding and scrutiny over time.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how science is applied across societies and industries; and in research.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate issues which involve and/or require scientific understanding.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how people develop and use scientific understanding; as individuals and through collaboration; e.g. through peer-review.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how the uses of science can have a global environmental impact.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe what an analogy is and how it can be used as a model.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use an existing analogy for a purpose.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use symbols and formulae to represent scientific ideas.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify whether a given hypothesis is testable.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how scientific hypotheses can be supported or contradicted by evidence from an enquiry.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make predictions of likely outcomes for a scientific enquiry based on scientific knowledge and understanding.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Plan a range of investigations of different types; while considering variables appropriately; and recognise that not all investigations can be fair tests.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make risk assessments for practical work to identify and control risks.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Sort; group and classify phenomena; objects; materials and organisms through testing; observation; using secondary information; and making and using keys.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Decide what equipment is required to carry out an investigation or experiment and use it appropriately.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate whether measurements and observations have been repeated sufficiently to be reliable.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Take appropriately accurate and precise measurements; explaining why accuracy and precision are important.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Carry out practical work safely; supported by risk assessments where appropriate.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate a range of secondary information sources for their relevance and know that some sources may be biased.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Collect and record sufficient observations and/or measurements in an appropriate form.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the accuracy of predictions; based on results; and suggest why they were or were not accurate.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe trends and patterns in results; including identifying any anomalous results.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make conclusions by interpreting results and explain the limitations of the conclusions.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate experiments and investigations; and suggest improvements; explaining any proposed changes.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Present and interpret observations and measurements appropriately.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify ball-and-socket and hinge joints; and explain how antagonistic muscles move the bones at a hinge joint.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the components of blood and their functions (limited to red blood cells transporting oxygen; white blood cells protecting against pathogens and plasma transporting blood cells; nutrients and carbon dioxide).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how the structure of the human respiratory system is related to its function of gas exchange (in terms of lung structure and the action of the diaphragm and intercostal muscles) and understand the difference between breathing and respiration.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the diffusion of oxygen and carbon dioxide between blood and the air in the lungs.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify the constituents of a balanced diet for humans as including protein; carbohydrates; fats and oils; water; minerals (limited to calcium and iron) and vitamins (limited to A; C and D); and describe the functions of these nutrients.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that carbohydrates and fats can be used as a store of energy in animals; and animals consume food to obtain energy and nutrients.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how human growth; development and health can be affected by lifestyle; including diet and smoking.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that aerobic respiration occurs in the mitochondria of plant and animal cells; and gives a controlled release of energy.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know and use the summary word equation for aerobic respiration (glucose + oxygen -> carbon dioxide + water).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify different ecosystems on the Earth; recognising the variety of habitats that exist within an ecosystem.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the impact of the bioaccumulation of toxic substances on an ecosystem.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how a new and/or invasive species can affect other organisms and an ecosystem.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the Rutherford model of the structure of an atom.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that electrons have negative charge; protons have positive charge and neutrons have no charge.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that the electrostatic attraction between positive and negative charge is what holds together individual atoms.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that purity is a way to describe how much of a specific chemical is in a mixture.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the concentration of a solution relates to how many particles of the solute are present in a volume of the solvent.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how paper chromatography can be used to separate and identify substances in a sample.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use word equations to describe reactions.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that some processes and reactions are endothermic or exothermic; and this can be identified by temperature change.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the reactivity of metals (limited to sodium; potassium; calcium; magnesium; zinc; iron; copper; gold and silver) with oxygen; water and dilute acids.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that reactions do not always lead to a single pure product and that sometimes a reaction will produce an impure mixture of products.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how the solubility of different salts varies with temperature.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that some substances are generally unreactive and can be described as inert.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Calculate speed (speed = distance / time).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Interpret and draw simple distance / time graphs.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the effects of balanced and unbalanced forces on motion.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify and calculate turning forces (moment = force x distance).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain that pressure is caused by the action of a force; exerted by a substance; on an area (pressure = force / area).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use particle theory to explain pressures in gases and liquids (qualitative only).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the diffusion of gases and liquids as the intermingling of substances by the movement of particles.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe reflection at a plane surface and use the law of reflection.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe refraction of light at the boundary between air and glass or air and water in terms of change of speed.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that white light is made of many colours and this can be shown through the dispersion of white light; using a prism.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how colours of light can be added; subtracted; absorbed and reflected.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe a magnetic field; and understand that it surrounds a magnet and exerts a force on other magnetic fields.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how to make an electromagnet and know that electromagnets have many applications.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Investigate factors that change the strength of an electromagnet.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that the reason the Earth has a magnetic field is that the core acts as a magnet.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify renewable resources (including wind; tidal and solar power; and bioplastics) and non-renewable resources (including fossil fuels); and describe how humans use them.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that there is evidence that the Earth's climate exists in a cycle between warm periods and ice ages; and the cycle takes place over long time periods.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the Earth's climate can change due to atmospheric change.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the difference between climate and weather.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe a galaxy in terms of stellar dust and gas; stars and planetary systems.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe asteroids as rocks; smaller than planets; and describe their formation from rocks left over from the formation of a planetary system.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how scientific knowledge is developed through collective understanding and scrutiny over time.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how science is applied across societies and industries; and in research.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate issues which involve and/or require scientific understanding.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how people develop and use scientific understanding as individuals and through collaboration; e.g. through peer-review.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how the uses of science can have a global environmental impact.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that models and analogies reflect current scientific evidence and understanding and can change.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe some important models; including analogies; and discuss their strengths and limitations.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use symbols and formulae to represent scientific ideas.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Suggest a testable hypothesis based on scientific understanding.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe examples where scientists' unexpected results from enquiries have led to improved scientific understanding.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make predictions of likely outcomes for a scientific enquiry based on scientific knowledge and understanding.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Plan a range of investigations of different types to obtain appropriate evidence when testing hypotheses.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make risk assessments for practical work to identify and control risks.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Sort; group and classify phenomena; objects; materials and organisms through testing; observation; using secondary information; and making and using keys.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Decide what equipment is required to carry out an investigation or experiment and use it appropriately.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Decide when to increase the range of observations and measurements; and increase the extent of repetition; to give sufficiently reliable data.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Take appropriately accurate and precise measurements; explaining why accuracy and precision are important.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Carry out practical work safely; supported by risk assessments where appropriate.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make an informed decision whether to use evidence from first-hand experience or secondary sources.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Collect; record and summarise sufficient observations and measurements; in an appropriate form.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate the strength of the evidence collected and how it supports; or refutes; the prediction.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe trends and patterns in results; identifying any anomalous results and suggesting why results are anomalous.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make conclusions by interpreting results; explain the limitations of the conclusions and describe how the conclusions can be further investigated.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate experiments and investigations; including those by others; and suggest improvements; explaining any proposed changes.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Present and interpret results; and predict results between the data points collected.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the pathway of water and mineral salts from the roots to the leaves in flowering plants; including absorption in root hair cells; transport through xylem and transpiration from the surface of leaves.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the structure of the human excretory (renal) system and its function (limited to kidneys filtering blood to remove urea; which is excreted in urine).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that chromosomes contain genes; made of DNA; and that genes contribute to the determination of an organism's characteristics.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the fusion of gametes to produce a fertilised egg with a new combination of DNA.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the inheritance of sex in humans in terms of XX and XY chromosomes.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe variation within a species and relate this to genetic differences between individuals.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the scientific theory of natural selection and how it relates to genetic changes over time.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that plants require minerals to maintain healthy growth and life processes (limited to magnesium to make chlorophyll and nitrates to make protein).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that photosynthesis occurs in chloroplasts and is the process by which plants make carbohydrates; using the energy from light.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know and use the summary word equation for photosynthesis (carbon dioxide + water -> glucose + oxygen; in the presence of light and chlorophyll).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how fetal development is affected by the health of the mother; including the effect of diet; smoking and drugs.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe what could happen to the population of a species; including extinction; when there is an environmental change.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the structure of the Periodic Table is related to the atomic structure of the elements and the Periodic Table can be used to predict an elementâ€™s structure and properties.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that a molecule is formed when two or more atoms join together chemically; through a covalent bond.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe a covalent bond as a bond made when a pair of electrons is shared by two atoms (limited to single bonds).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe an ion as an atom which has gained at least one electron to be negatively charged or lost at least one electron to be positively charged.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe an ionic bond as an attraction between a positively charged ion and a negatively charged ion.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that the groups within the Periodic Table have trends in physical and chemical properties; using group 1 as an example.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how the density of a substance relates to its mass in a defined volume.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Calculate and compare densities of solids; liquids and gases.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that elements and compounds exist in structures (simple or giant); and this influences their physical properties.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use word equations and symbol equations to describe reactions (balancing symbol equations is not required).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify examples of displacement reactions and predict products (limited to reactions involving calcium; magnesium; zinc; iron; copper; gold and silver salts).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how to prepare some common salts by the reactions of metals with acids; and metal carbonates with acids; and purify them; using filtration; evaporation and crystallisation.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the effects of concentration; surface area and temperature on the rate of reaction; and explain them using the particle model.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand that in chemical reactions mass and energy are conserved.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use density to explain why objects float or sink in water.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the difference between heat and temperature.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that energy is conserved; meaning it cannot be created or destroyed.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that thermal energy will always transfer from hotter regions or objects to colder ones; and this is known as heat dissipation.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe thermal transfer by the processes of conduction; convection and radiation.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain cooling by evaporation.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Draw and interpret waveforms; and recognise the link between loudness and amplitude; pitch and frequency.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use waveforms to show how sound waves interact to reinforce or cancel each other.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how current divides in parallel circuits.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know how to measure current and voltage in series and parallel circuits; and describe the effect of adding cells and lamps.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Calculate resistance (resistance = voltage / current) and describe how resistance affects current.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use diagrams and conventional symbols to represent; make and compare circuits that include cells; switches; resistors (fixed and variable); ammeters; voltmeters; lamps and buzzers.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain the movement of tectonic plates in terms of convection currents.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain why the jigsaw appearance of continental coasts; location of volcanoes and earthquakes; fossil record and alignment of magnetic materials in the Earth's crust are all evidence for tectonic plates.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the carbon cycle (limited to photosynthesis; respiration; feeding; decomposition and combustion).

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the historical and predicted future impacts of climate change; including sea level change; flooding; drought and extreme weather events.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the consequences of asteroid collision with the Earth; including climate change and mass extinctions.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the evidence for the collision theory for the formation of the Moon.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that nebulae are clouds of dust and gas; and can act as stellar nurseries.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how scientific knowledge is developed through collective understanding and scrutiny over time.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how science is applied across societies and industries; and in research.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate issues which involve and/or require scientific understanding.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how people develop and use scientific understanding as individuals and through collaboration; e.g. through peer-review.

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how the uses of science can have a global environmental impact.

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: a) identify the four cardinal points of a compass

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: b) use the four cardinal points to give directions on a map

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: c) appreciate the use of four cardinal points in everyday life

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Sub-strand: 1.2 Location and size of the County
lessons.Learning Objective: a) identify sub-counties in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Sub-strand: 1.2 Location and size of the County
lessons.Learning Objective: b) locate the county in relation to neighbouring counties

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Sub-strand: 1.2 Location and size of the County
lessons.Learning Objective: c) estimate the size of the county in relation to neighbouring counties

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Sub-strand: 1.2 Location and size of the County
lessons.Learning Objective: d) acknowledge the location and size of the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: a) identify the main physical features in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: b) state the importance of the main physical features in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: c) illustrate the main physical features in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: d) appreciate the main physical features in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: a) identify the four seasons experienced in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: b) explain how the four seasons influence human activities in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: c) explore how rainy weather affects road safety in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: d) model weather charts of seasons in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Learning Objective: e) appreciate the different seasons experienced in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Sub-strand: 1.5 Historic Built Environments in the County
lessons.Learning Objective: a) identify the main historic built environments in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Sub-strand: 1.5 Historic Built Environments in the County
lessons.Learning Objective: b) explain the importance of the main historic built environments in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Sub-strand: 1.5 Historic Built Environments in the County
lessons.Learning Objective: c) participate in conservation activities of the historic built environments within the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
lessons.Sub-strand: 1.5 Historic Built Environments in the County
lessons.Learning Objective: d) appreciate historic built environments in the county

lessons.Subject: Social Studies
